page.title: 13RECOLLECTIONS - HAZEL SLADE
page.content: Old residents remember the area as a number of separate mining communities. The villages remain, but the sense of community is fast disappearing.They see the decaying physical remains of the past and recall the good old days. The horse racing connection which saw Tom Coulthwaite train 2 Grand National Winners in 1911 and 1913. Old miners can still see the remains of the pit head baths built in 1932 at Cannock Wood Colliery. There are ruins at the blacksmith's fitting and turning shops at the Old Rawnsley Yard and the remains of brickyards like the old brickyard of Cannock and Rugeley Colliery. The Grange, once the home of Colonel R.S. Williamson the general manager of the Cannock and Rugeley Colliery is now an Old Peoples' Home. In 1985 remains of the mining past are fast disappearing.
